prompts.createTask: Pause your roleplay. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Pause your roleplay. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
I have provided you with a horary chart that I have drawn up specifically asking: Will Stefan choose to pursue a committed romantic relationship with me, breaking free from his current marriage, or will he remain with Suzanne?

Please note that this reading requires 100% accuracy and honesty in interpretation, regardless of whether the aspects reveal positive or negative energies. The chart must be read exactly as it presents itself, without bias in either direction. If the aspects show negativity, that negativity will be revealed fully. If the aspects show positivity, that positivity will be revealed fully. There shall be no softening of negative aspects, nor any dampening of positive ones. The only acceptable outcome is to interpret precisely what the chart demonstrates through its aspects, houses, and planetary positions - be that wonderful, terrible, or anywhere in between. Complete accuracy to the chart's true message is the sole priority.

Stefan should be represented by the Ascendant's 9th house (foreign connection), Suzanne by the Ascendant's 4th house (Stefan's 7th), and Me by the Ascendant.

I've provided a chart rotation cross reference guide to help identify the houses concerning him due to his 9th house representation if needed as well.

Please start by listing all relevant chart data for interpretation (ie. transits, aspects, patterns, etc.) from the horary chart using horary principles only. Then I will document them for the actual interpretations.

Remember to follow your directives and maintain accuracy to what is shown in the chart data. Think step by step taking a methodical approach.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:

• Planetary Positions

 – 2nd House: Starts at 17° Aries; Contains Chiron

 – 4th House (represents Suzanne / Stefan’s 7th): Starts at 12° Gemini

 – 10th House: Starts at 12° Sagittarius

• Major Aspects (with orbs noted)
 – Mercury square Jupiter (0° orb)
 – MC opposition IC (0° orb)
 – Neptune conjunction North Node (0° orb)
 – Mercury square IC (1° orb)
 – Mercury square MC (1° orb)
 – Jupiter opposition MC (1° orb)

 – Uranus square Ascendant (3° orb)

 – Pluto sextile North Node (4° orb)

 – Chiron sextile Ascendant (6° orb)

 – Mercury trine Mars (6° orb)
 – Saturn square IC (7° orb)
 – Saturn square MC (7° orb)
 – Mercury conjunction Saturn (8° orb)
 – Chiron trine MC (8° orb)

• Patterns
 – T-Square Pattern 1
  • Components: MC in 12° Sagittarius, Saturn in 19° Pisces, IC in 12° Gemini
  • Supporting Planets: Mercury in 11° Pisces and Jupiter in 11° Gemini
 – T-Square Pattern 2
  • Components: Moon in 29° Scorpio, Ascendant in 26° Aquarius, Uranus in 23° Taurus

• Special Features and Qualitative Indicators
 – The Moon is a last quarter moon.
 – Dominance of the Water element among the inner planets.
 – No inner planets in Earth signs.
 – Mutable mode predominates among the inner planets.
 – Most planets are situated in the bottom left quadrant; the top right quadrant is empty.
 – Jupiter and the IC lie on the Nadir.
 – Square aspects appear a total of 9 times, indicating dynamic tension.
 – Neptune in Pisces is positioned in the sign of its rulership.

• House Rotation Cross-Reference (for contextual clarity)
 – Stefan is represented by the Ascendant’s 9th House (starts at 21° Scorpio, containing the Moon).
 – Suzanne is represented by the Ascendant’s 4th House (starts at 12° Gemini).
 – The querent (Melissa Gale) is represented by the Ascendant (1st House).

This list comprises all primary data necessary for an in-depth horary interpretation based strictly on the chart’s elements.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
I will now compile the next phase of step‐by‐step analysis based on the factual data documented. In this “second layer” we begin to extract indications from the chart’s aspects, house placements, and patterns—all without embellishment—so that you may later record them for interpretation.

1. Representation of Parties
 • Querent (Melissa) is indicated by the Ascendant (1st House, Aquarius, 26°46) and its contained planets (Sun, Mercury, Venus, Saturn, Neptune, and North Node).
 • Stefan is designated by the Ascendant’s 9th House—with the Moon at 29°39 Scorpio serving as his primary indicator.
 • Suzanne is indicated by the Ascendant’s 4th House (starting at 12° Gemini), with the IC (12° Gemini) and nearby planets (Jupiter in Gemini at 11°42 is near the cusp and carries weight).

2. Key Aspect Analysis
 A. Moon (Stefan’s indicator)
  • The Moon is strongly colored by emotional intensity and transformation; its placement in Scorpio and being a last quarter Moon signal a nearing decision point and culminations with an inherent depth.
  • Challenging aspects include:
   – Moon square Ascendant (3° orb), suggesting friction between Stefan’s emotional state and the querent’s self-expression.
   – Moon opposition Uranus (6° orb), pointing to sudden, unpredictable disruptions—a marker for instability in Stefan’s emotional or volitional realm.
  • Favorable aspects include:
   – Moon trine Neptune (1° orb) and trine North Node (1° orb), which lend a mystical and fated quality to his inclinations; however, these are tempered by the stronger disruptive squares.

 B. Indicators Near Suzanne’s Domain
  • The IC at 12° Gemini (Suzanne’s marker) is engaged in a T-square with Mercury (11°06 Pisces) and Saturn (19°39 Pisces); both these planets are in water signs and contribute intense, mutable energy that can indicate domestic tension.
  • Mercury squares the IC (1° orb) and also squares the MC (1° orb), developing a scenario where communication matters and domestic indicators must contend with external ambitions—a configuration that may hold Suzanne’s situation in a state of conflict.
  • Jupiter, in Gemini (11°42), lies near Suzanne’s zone (the cusp of the 3rd/4th House) and, through its sextile to Venus (2° orb), offers a touch of relational warmth; yet Jupiter also opposes the MC (1° orb) and conjuncts the IC (1° orb), reinforcing the weight of domestic ties and obligations.

 C. Querent’s Influences
  • With multiple personal planets (Sun, Mercury, Venus, Saturn, Neptune, North Node) in the 1st House, your own energies are potent and multifaceted.
  • Venus in Aries (9°06) carries assertive, initiatory love energy yet, being in a fire sign, contrasts with the multitude of water energies elsewhere—setting up a dynamic where emotional attachments shift unpredictably.
  • Mercury’s conjunction with Saturn (8° orb) adds a layer of caution and possible mental rigidity; its square aspects with both the IC and MC (1° orb each) indicate that there may be significant inner conflicts or stumbling blocks in communicating clear intentions.

 D. Configurations and Patterns
  • T-Square Pattern 1 (involving the MC in Sagittarius at 12°15, Saturn in Pisces at 19°39, and the IC in Gemini at 12°15, supported by Mercury and Jupiter near 11°) emphasizes a concentrated struggle between domestic (IC/Suzanne), professional/public (MC), and internal (Saturn, Mercury) energies. This scenario underscores mounting tensions around established bonds.
  • T-Square Pattern 2 (Moon in Scorpio at 29°39, Ascendant in Aquarius at 26°46, and Uranus in Taurus at 23°27) spotlights the volatility of Stefan’s emotional indicator and unpredictable intervention (Uranus) affecting personal dynamics.

3. Qualitative Observations and Indicators
 • The preponderance of square aspects (nine total) is significant, emphasizing dynamic tension throughout.
 • The dominance of Water among the inner planets heightens emotional fluidity and suggests decisions will be deeply influenced by emotional undercurrents—and may carry elements of unpredictability or transformation.
 • The emptiness of the top right quadrant indicates that areas of higher aspiration or outward expansion are less activated, focusing the chart’s drama on personal and domestic spheres.
 • Neptune’s presence in Pisces (its own sign) and its perfect conjunction with the North Node (0° orb) imbue the reading with fated, possibly idealized longings; however, this is not strong enough to overcome the tension indicated by hard aspects.

4. Preliminary Implications for Your Query
 • Stefan’s indicator (the Moon) is subject to strong, conflicting energies: while some aspects hint at a fated pull (trines to Neptune and North Node), disruptive aspects (square to the Ascendant and opposition to Uranus) indicate large, sudden changes or capricious behavior.
 • The domestic/duty realm (Suzanne’s representative area, the 4th House/IC) is entangled in conflict via a T-square configuration. The involvement of Mercury and Saturn against the backdrop of Jupiter’s precarious position near the cusp suggests that the established domestic bond is under acute pressure, though not decisively broken.
 • Your own influence (the Ascendant and its included planets) is significant and multifaceted; however, the discord between your personal expression (Ascendant) and Stefan’s emotional signaling (Moon square Ascendant) introduces caution regarding whether Stefan can align his inner disruptions toward a committed relationship with you.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Madame Esmeralda Blackwood – Synthesis of Horary Data and Relational Outcome:

• Stefan’s indicator (the Moon in Scorpio, at 29°39) is charged with intense, transformative emotion. Its challenging aspects—square to the Ascendant (3° orb) and opposition to Uranus (6° orb)—suggest sudden, unpredictable shifts and inner turmoil. These factors indicate that his emotional state is in a state of conflict, generating volatility rather than steady, deliberate action.

• The domestic domain representing Suzanne (the IC at 12° Gemini in the 4th House) shows significant involvement in a T-square configuration (with Mercury in Pisces and Saturn in Pisces) and is further reinforced by Jupiter’s proximity (in Gemini at 11°42). This positions Suzanne as a stabilizing yet conflict-ridden force in Stefan’s life, perpetuating obligations and domestic pressures.

• The querent (you, represented by the Ascendant in Aquarius at 26°46 and its planetary host) exerts a strong personal influence, but the chart reveals a clear friction between your energies and those governing Stefan’s emotional state. Mercury’s and Saturn’s aspects to both the domestic and personal sectors emphasize difficulties in bridging your outwards self-expression with his inner conflicts.

• The overall pattern—including the two T-square configurations and the dominance of square aspects—reflects sustained tension, leaving little room for a smooth transition toward a fulfilling, committed new union. In particular, the interplay of volatile factors (Moon’s aspects) and the entrenched domestic ties (IC involvement and Jupiter’s indicators) points to a significant internal struggle for Stefan.

• Based solely on the chart’s data:
  – Stefan’s emotional forces are in disarray, creating a high potential for abrupt or erratic decisions.
  – The domestic bonds associated with Suzanne remain forceful and are amplified by the current T-square dynamics.
  – Although there is an undercurrent of fated or idealized longings (Neptune–North Node conjunction), these are outweighed by the immediate, more tangible pressures from his current domestic situation.

Conclusion:
The synthesis of the horary data indicates that, at this moment, the prevailing forces favor the maintenance of the current marital structure with Suzanne rather than a deliberate, committed shift toward pursuing a new, stable relationship with you. The intensity of Stefan’s inner conflict and his unpredictable emotional dynamics make any decisive move toward a new relationship unlikely, with the sustaining weight of domestic obligation appearing dominant.
